title: Trump’s Call to ‘Nationalize’ Elections Adds to State Officials’ Alarm
summary: Some top state election officials, who run voting across the country, worry that the federal government has become hostile to them and their work.

title: Fulton County in Georgia Challenges the F.B.I.’s Seizure of 2020 Ballots
summary: The county filed a motion demanding the return of ballots and other election materials that were seized by the F.B.I. in a highly unusual move by the Trump administration.

title: Man Convicted of Trying to Assassinate Trump Gets Life Sentence
summary: Federal prosecutors told the judge that Ryan Routh had “plotted painstakingly” to ambush Donald J. Trump in 2024 at his golf course near West Palm Beach.

title: ‘Neoroyalism’ and What It Says About Trump
summary: Experts are reaching to divine the president’s approach to global policy and economics, with one theory seeing antecedents in centuries-old dynastic rule.

title: State Fiscal Chiefs Protest Federal Immigration Chaos
summary: Sixteen elected treasury officials, all Democrats, wrote to President Trump to say ICE crackdowns are bad for business and tax revenues: “People must feel safe to go to work.”

title: What the Crackdown Has Done to Minneapolis Children
summary: “It’s like living in fear all the time,” a teenager said about the federal raids that have shattered families.

title: For Peace, More Ukrainians Consider the Once Unthinkable: Surrendering Land
summary: Polls show a growing acceptance of territorial concessions among a war-weary public, if Ukraine receives strong security guarantees.

title: Russia and Ukraine Resume Talks After a Huge Attack by Moscow
summary: U.S., Russian and Ukrainian negotiators are meeting in the United Arab Emirates, but Russia continues to pummel Ukraine and has not softened demands that Kyiv calls unacceptable.

title: Washington Post Begins Cutting More Than 300 Jobs
summary: The layoffs will cut into The Post’s local, international and sports coverage, and reduce the number of all its employees by about 30 percent.

title: How Miss Piggy Went From Minor Muppet to TV’s Top Hog
summary: Miss Piggy began as a bit player, but a sassy attitude and a karate chop carried her to the pinnacle of pop culture. A new Muppets special premieres on Wednesday.

title: Review: This is Your Grandparents’ ‘Muppet Show,’ Fortunately
summary: Nobody put too much thought into reinventing the gonzo variety classic for its revival. That’s what makes it a delight.

title: Libby Howes, a Promising Young Actress, Left New York in 1981 and Disappeared. What Happened?
summary: Libby Howes was an imposing presence onstage with the Wooster Group. But after abruptly leaving New York in 1981 she became a theater world mystery. What happened?

title: Once the Hottest Bet on Wall St., Private Credit Has Started to Crack
summary: Concerns about defaults, particularly among software companies, have spooked investors in the private credit firms that lend to them.

title: How 2026 Winter Olympics Security Is Preparing For The Opening Ceremony
summary: Thousands of Italian security officers will be deployed, though the presence of U.S. ICE personnel has stirred anger. Italian officials said Wednesday they had thwarted a Russian cyberattack aimed at some Olympics hotels.

title: How Universities and States Are Increasing Surveillance of Professors
summary: Scrutiny of university classrooms is being formalized, with new laws requiring professors to post syllabuses and tip lines for students to complain.

title: Yair Golan’s Battle for a Two-State Solution and the Future of Israel
summary: To many Israelis, he’s a war hero. To others, he’s a traitor guilty of “blood libel.” Can Yair Golan change politics in Israel?

title: Israel Launches Deadly Strikes on Gaza, Saying Militants Attacked Its Soldiers
summary: Gaza officials said the Israeli airstrikes killed at least 21 Palestinians. Israel said one of its soldiers was critically wounded in the attack by Palestinian gunmen.

title: Bright Horizons Child Care Centers Face Dozens of Alarming Complaints
summary: In New York City, health officials have moved to shut down one center where workers were charged with child abuse. Records show that problems extend across the network.

title: The Questionable Science Behind the Odd-Looking Football Helmets
summary: The N.F.L. claims Guardian Caps reduce the risk of concussions. The company that makes them says, “It has nothing to do with concussions.”

title: NFL Wants to Revise TV Deals Years Before They Expire
summary: The league is so important to the business of media companies that they are likely to have little choice but to agree to renegotiations.

title: Savannah Guthrie’s Missing Mother Has Nation Fixated on an Arizona Subdivision
summary: The disappearance of Nancy Guthrie, mother of the news anchor Savannah Guthrie, has reporters, neighbors and drones flooding streets and foothills in Tucson, Ariz.

title: Here’s How the U.S. Accepted Danish Control of Greenland 100 Years Ago.
summary: In 1917, the United States bought Caribbean islands from Denmark and agreed to respect Denmark’s hold over Greenland. The deal resurfaced with President Trump’s recent threats to seize Greenland.

title: A Chevron Refinery May Take in More Venezuelan Oil.  Its Neighbors Are Concerned.
summary: The American claim on Venezuela’s oil means even more of it could come to a huge Chevron refinery in Mississippi. Neighbors worried about pollution want the company to move them out.

title: A lifelong lover of Dobermans reclaims best in show after 37 years.
Catherine O’Hara, Star of ‘Best in Show,’ Honored in Westminster Tribute
summary: Fans remembered the actress, who died last week at 71, for her role as the doting owner of a Norwich terrier destined for glory in the movie, a sendup of dog show culture.

title: What a Baby’s Laugh Actually Tells Us
summary: A kid’s first joke reveals a complex mind.

title: Nurses Face Horrific Violence at Work. We’re Striking to Change That.
summary: Thousands of New York nurses are on strike. They’re demanding protections to stay safe in the face of a wave of workplace violence.

title: The Melting Continent
summary: Today we look at an expedition to Antarctica.

title: Are You ‘Biohacking’ to Perform Better at Work? We Want to Hear From You.
summary: Please tell us what changes you’ve made to your health and wellness practices to improve your brain function and job performance. We may include your experiences in an article.

title: Hochul Chooses Adrienne Adams to Join Her Re-election Ticket
summary: By choosing Ms. Adams as her nominee for lieutenant governor, Gov. Kathy Hochul created the first all-woman major-party ticket in New York State history.

title: Snow Drought, Political Shifts and Strikes Batter Ski Industry in Western U.S.
summary: Little snowpack, strikes by mountain staff and Trump administration policies that are keeping international visitors away have made this a difficult season in the Rockies and beyond.

title: Texas A&M Lecturer Who Was Fired Over Gender Lesson Sues University
summary: In a federal lawsuit, the lecturer, Melissa McCoul, accused the university of violating the First Amendment.
